00079 /*
00080  * Simple array (vector) types. There is an array type
00081  * for each of {u,s}{8,16,32,64}v and u1v and utf8v.
00082  *
00083  * The member variables are:
00084  *      m_nValue            The number of array elements
00085  *      m_pValue            Pointer to the first element
00086  *
00087  * The interfaces:
00088  *      llrp_XXv_t(void)    Default constructor, just sets the
00089  *                          member fields to zero.
00090  *      llrp_XXv_t(llrp_XXv_t & rOther)
00091  *                          Constructor that clones an existing object.
00092  *      ~llrp_XXv_t(void)   Destructor, just deletes m_pValue in case
00093  *                          there is something allocated to it.
00094  *      operator=           Assignment operator. Used to copy an
00095  *                          existing instance. It's careful
00096  *                          to delete m_pValue before overwriting it.
00097  *
00098  * Private subroutines
00099  *      copy()              Makes a copy, supports operator=
00100  *      reset()             Clears the variable much like the
00101  *                          destructor does.
00102  */
00103 
00111 class llrp_u8v_t
00112 {
00113   public:
00115     llrp_u16_t                  m_nValue;
00117     llrp_u8_t *                 m_pValue;
00118 
00120     llrp_u8v_t(void);
00121 
00123     llrp_u8v_t (
00124       unsigned int              nValue);
00125 
00127     llrp_u8v_t (
00128       const llrp_u8v_t &        rOther);
00129 
00131     ~llrp_u8v_t(void);
00132 
00134     llrp_u8v_t &
00135     operator= (
00136       const llrp_u8v_t &        rValue);
00137 
00138   private:
00139     void
00140     copy (
00141       const llrp_u8v_t &        rOther);
00142 
00143     void
00144     reset (void);
00145 };

00601 enum EResultCode
00602 {
00603     RC_OK                       = 0,   
00604     RC_MiscError                = 100, 
00605     RC_Botch,                          
00606     RC_SendIOError,                    
00607     RC_RecvIOError,                    
00608     RC_RecvEOF,                        
00609     RC_RecvTimeout,                    
00610     RC_RecvFramingError,               
00611     RC_RecvBufferOverflow,             
00612     RC_BadVersion,                     
00613     RC_MissingResponseType,            
00614     RC_UnknownMessageType,             
00615     RC_UnknownParameterType,           
00616     RC_ExcessiveLength,                
00617     RC_InvalidLength,                  
00618     RC_FieldUnderrun,                  
00619     RC_ReservedBitsUnderrun,           
00620     RC_FieldOverrun,                   
00621     RC_ReservedBitsOverrun,            
00622     RC_UnalignedBitField,              
00623     RC_UnalignedReservedBits,          
00624     RC_MessageAllocationFailed,        
00625     RC_ParameterAllocationFailed,      
00626     RC_FieldAllocationFailed,          
00627     RC_ExtraBytes,                     
00628     RC_MissingParameter,               
00629     RC_UnexpectedParameter,            
00630     RC_InvalidChoiceMember,            
00631     RC_EnrollBadTypeNumber,            
00632     RC_NotAllowedAtExtensionPoint,     
00633     RC_XMLInvalidNodeType,             
00634     RC_XMLMissingField,                
00635     RC_XMLExtraNode,                   
00636     RC_XMLInvalidFieldCharacters,      
00637     RC_XMLOutOfRange,                  
00638 };

00825 class CFieldDescriptor
00826 {
00827   public:
00829     enum FieldType {
00830         FT_U8,  FT_S8,  FT_U8V,  FT_S8V,
00831         FT_U16, FT_S16, FT_U16V, FT_S16V,
00832         FT_U32, FT_S32, FT_U32V, FT_S32V,
00833         FT_U64, FT_S64, FT_U64V, FT_S64V,
00834 
00835         FT_U1,  FT_U1V, FT_U2,   FT_U96,
00836         FT_UTF8V,
00837 
00838         FT_E1, FT_E2, FT_E8, FT_E16, FT_E32,
00839         FT_E8V,
00840 
00841         FT_BYTESTOEND,
00842     };
00843 
00845     enum FieldFormat {
00846         FMT_NORMAL,
00847         FMT_DEC,
00848         FMT_HEX,
00849         FMT_UTF8,
00850         FMT_DATETIME,
00851     };
00852 
00854     FieldType                   m_eFieldType;
00856     FieldFormat                 m_eFieldFormat;
00858     char *                      m_pName;
00860     const SEnumTableEntry *     m_pEnumTable;
00861 };

00878 /*
00879  * SEnumTableEntry
00880  *
00881  * @brief Simple table of enumerations. Table is terminated
00882  * by an entry with pName==NULL.
00883  */
00884 struct SEnumTableEntry
00885 {
00886     /* String name, (e.g. "Immediate") */
00887     char *                      pName;
00888     int                         Value;
00889 };

00920     enroll (
00921       const CTypeDescriptor *   pTypeDescriptor);

00925     lookupMessage (
00926       unsigned int              MessageTypeNum) const;

00930     lookupParameter (

01793 /*
01794 ** @brief Encodes a CElement into an XML string
01795 **
01796 ** @param[in]  pElement      The CElement to encode to XML
01797 ** @param[out] pBuffer       The pointer to the buffer in which to place the XML result
01798 ** @param[in]  nBuffer       The size of the buffer available to hold the XML
01799 **
01800 ** @return EResultCode Result code from the operation
01801 */
